body.p: “Saw again the red huckleberry and the white hardhack. I think this the lay of the land:-- [image] The red huckleberry is as easily distinguished in the green state as when ripe. It is then red with a white cheek “,” often slightly pear-shaped “,” semitransparent with a lustre “,” very finely and indistinctly white-dotted. I do not perceive any very marked peculiarity in the bush “,” unless that the recent twigs are red. The last year’s a peculiar ochreous color and the red buds in the axils larger. It might be called Gaylussacia resinos var. erythrocarpa.”
PE 11, pg. 7-8 / 23 April-6 September 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:27 / T vol. # XXI / PDF # XV / JVIII & JIX
